author: Verónica Pavés
title: El fuerte viento obliga a suspender el ocio al aire libre este fin de semana en Tenerife
text:
Actualizada 13 DIC 2024 18:49 Un fuerte viento azotará a Canarias este fin de semana. La Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (Aemet) espera que la provincia occidental (La Palma, La Gomera, El Hierro y Tenerife ) se vea afectada por fuertes rachas de hasta 90 kilómetros por hora que han obligado a algunos municipios a suspender el ocio al aire libre. En Tenerife, además, el Cabildo insular ha decidido cerrar los senderos y prohibir su acceso a pie en el Teide, recordando que incumplir esta norma conlleva a una sanción de entre 600 y hasta 12.000 euros si requiere ser rescatado.
La Aemet ha activado para este sábado y domingo los avisos amarillos por fuertes vientos, que serán naranjas en El Hierro, la isla más afectada por este temporal. El viento empezará a arreciar sobre las 9 de esta mañana de sábado e irá acompañado de lluvias débiles y ocasionales al final del día. La entrada de aire vendrá acompañada de un ascenso generalizado de las temperaturas que será más notable en las vertientes norte y oeste de esta provincia. Esta previsión meteorológica ha motivado que la Dirección General de Emergencias del Gobierno de Canarias decretara en la mañana de este viernes la situación de alerta por vientos en la isla de Tenerife desde el sábado 14 de diciembre.
Prohiben el acceso a pie al Teide por la alerta de vientos
Vientos fuertes en El Hierro y La Gomera El viento soplará en las islas occidentales del sureste, lo que provocará que iuntervalos fuertes y rachas muy fuertes. El Golfo, en El Hierro y en el norte y oeste de La Gomera. En ambos lugares se podrán registrar rachas máximas de hasta 90 kilómetros por hora. Al final del día, el viento cogerá fuerza en las cumbres de La Palma y Tenerife. Razón por la cual el Cabildo tinerfeño ha decidido cerrar a cal y canto los senderos de Las Cañadas del Teide.
De esta manera el acceso a pie de los senderos del Parque Nacional del Teide estará prohibido a partir de las 00:00 horas del sábado 14 de diciembre. El Cabildo de Tenerife ha cerrado el acceso a pie de los senderos del Parque Nacional del Teide a partir de las 00:00 horas del sábado 14 de diciembre tras la declaración de alerta por viento decretada por el Gobierno de Canarias.
La presidenta del Cabildo, Rosa Dávila , ha destacado que la medida se adopta «para garantizar la seguridad de las personas». «Ante una situación de alerta por viento, hemos decidido cerrar los senderos de acceso a pie al Teide porque no es seguro transitar por ellos», añadió. No en vano, en las Cañadas del Teide y en cotas superiores a los 1.800 y 2.000 metros, se prevé viento del sur y suroeste fuerte, con una velocidad media de 50 y 80 kilómetros por hora, sin descartar velocidades superiores en el Pico del Teide , en las que se podrían producir rachas que alcanzarán y superarán los 90 kilómetros por hora.
Nubes altas, calima, vientos fuertes y temperaturas en ascenso este sábado en Canarias
Multas de hasta 600 euros Los senderos afectados son el del Montaña Blanca-Pico Teide, el Mirador de La Fortaleza, Telesforo Bravo, Mirador de Pico Viejo, Regatones Negros, Chafarí y Teide-Pico Viejo. Las personas que incumplan podrán ser sancionadas con una multa de 600 euros. A esa cantidad habrá que sumarle, en su caso, las tasas por rescate del Gobierno de Canarias o del Consorcio de Prevención, Extinción de Incendios y Salvamento de la Isla de Tenerife, que oscilan entre los 2.000 y los 12.000 euros.
En Tenerife, además, la capital tinerfeña ha decidido aplazar todas las actividades al aire libre organizadas por el Ayuntamiento de SantaCruz. También cerrarán las instalaciones municipales al aire libre que conlleven la afluencia de público (polideportivos, piscinas municipales, canchas deportivas, etc.) y cualquier otra de ocio y esparcimiento.
Se recomienda asegurar puertas, ventanas y toldos para evitar corrientes de aire que puedan llevar a la rotura y caída de cristales. También retirar de ventanas, balcones y azoteas las macetas y todos los objetos que puedan caer a la calle y provocar un accidente. Además, se deben revisar las viviendas para que no haya cornisas, balcones o fachadas en mal estado que puedan producir caídas de cascotes y escombros.

author: 聯合新聞網
title: 跨境電商成玩具安全漏洞 歐盟擬祭「數位護照」嚴禁PFAS
text:
跨境電商成玩具安全漏洞 歐盟擬祭「數位護照」嚴禁PFAS
歐洲議會與歐盟理事會4月10日達成協議，將加強管制玩具中的有害化學物質，特別是環境荷爾蒙與全氟烷基和多氟烷基物質（PFAS）。新規也要求歐盟製或進口玩具需以QR Code等方式載明數位護照，確保符合法規。為避免大型跨境電商平台成為管制漏洞，歐盟也要求網路平台須提供數位護照連結。
閱讀更多：商品也有護照了？ 歐盟要求揭露產品生命周期最快2026上路
加強管制環境荷爾蒙、PFAS
歐盟10日最新修訂的「玩具安全法規」（Toy Safety Regulation）中，新增了一批禁止添加的化學物質，包含內分泌干擾物質（又稱環境荷爾蒙）以及可能對肺部、皮膚或其他器官有害的物質。添加這類物質的玩具、娃娃、積木將禁止輸入歐洲，若這些成分位在兒童碰觸不到的位置則可放行，如玩具的電子零件。
PFAS是上萬種化合物的統稱，因不易降解而被稱為「永遠的化學品」，長期接觸可能引發新陳代謝、甲狀腺功能、肝指數、生殖能力異常等問題。在議會的堅持下，新規禁用雙酚類物質（Bisphenols）中最危險的類別與PFAS。
此外，36個月以下兒童的玩具禁用過敏性香料，因為他們可能會將玩具放到嘴巴裡。歐盟協議後的草案將在歐洲議會、理事會再次表決，通過後就會公告實施。
線上平台也要提供數位護照
歐盟協議要求，在歐盟販售的玩具均須附上「數位產品護照」（digital product passport, DPP），以證明符合歐盟安全規範。數位護照可加強產品的追溯性，提高海關查緝問題玩具的效率。這個「護照」可以用QR Code呈現，讓民眾也能透過條碼確認玩具的安全性。
網購已經成為家長購買玩具的主流，因此協議特別納入線上平台規範。平台可能需要重新設計，以便消費者在購買前就能看到產品的CE標誌、安全警告和顯示數位護照的連結資訊。CE標誌為歐盟強制性驗證標誌，代表該產品符合歐洲指令或法規。
「歐盟的玩具安全規範已是世界最嚴格的，但面對新興風險，我們仍需勤勞不懈、確保所有歐洲製或是外國製的玩具達到安全標準。」歐盟輪值主席國波蘭的科技部長帕斯季科（Krzysztof Paszyk）告訴《世界報》。
跨境網購成管制漏洞
玩具的「新興風險」與全球日益擴張的跨境電商有關。根據歐盟4月最新發表的「安全門」（Safety Gate）報告，2024年共有4137件非食物產品違反安全規範，其中化妝品占1/3，玩具占比高達15%。值得注意的是，排除化妝品的話，61%不合格產品來自中國。
歐盟執委會今年2月初才表示，他們將對中國跨境電商如希音（SHEIN）採取更完整的規範；挪威也將針對中國電商Temu販售的玩具祭出更嚴格管制。SHEIN與Temu都是專門經營歐美市場的大型平台，以極低價格和包山包海的商品種類聞名。
閱讀更多：91%低價包裹來自中國...歐盟報告：危險化妝品中國是最大來源地、占40%

author: @Kent_Online
title: Rare weather phenomenons seen recently across Kent including the Northern Lights and rainbow clouds
text: More on KentOnline People across Kent have cried with joy and ticked off parts of their bucket lists after they were lucky enough to catch a glimpse and photograph rare weather phenomena. We take a look at some of the remarkable events that happened around the county last year including the Northern Lights, rainbow clouds and dust devils. Northern Lights Skygazers were stunned to see the Northern Lights illuminating the skies over [Herne Bay](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/herne-bay/) and [Folkestone](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/folkestone/) in November. One of which was [Liz Whitehouse who managed to capture](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/herne-bay/news/stunning-photos-show-northern-lights-illuminating-kent-skies-296447/) a stunning image showing the mix of green, red and magenta colours glowing above. “A sight I thought I would never see in Kent (taken via phone camera), the Northern Lights from Reculver Towers,” her husband Adam posted on X, formally Twitter, alongside her pictures. The Met Office confirmed sightings across the UK but said the best chances to see the spectacle, also known as Aurora Borealis, were in Scotland. The Northern Lights are mostly seen in high-latitude regions and are caused by particles coming from the sun called the solar wind interacting with the Earth’s atmosphere. But it was not the only time the natural light display was seen in Kent. Two months before, photographer Chris Cork, from [Maidstone](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/maidstone/), captured [time-lapse footage of the Northern Lights](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/herne-bay/news/magnificent-time-lapse-footage-shows-northern-lights-over-293702/) at Reculver Beach. Speaking to KentOnline at the time, he said: “When I saw the pink and purple colours straight away I was like, ‘wow’. “I was excited to see the Aurora, it is quite rare to see it in the South East, we have gone out looking for it before but the conditions have never aligned before. “But this time it was really exciting because we caught the peak of it and we are really pleased with the results, it was a bit more subtle with the naked eye, but it is clear as day on camera.” Rainbow Clouds Even more multi-coloured lights were spotted just a few weeks ago over the [Isle of Sheppey](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/sheerness/), Maidstone, Herne Bay and [Whitstable](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/whitstable/). One emotional snapper [said she was starstruck at seeing the rainbow clouds](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/sheerness/news/multi-coloured-skies-bring-tears-of-joy-to-onlooker-299011/) - scientifically known as nacreous clouds – from her front garden in Princes Charles Avenue, Minster. Krystal Sheena Pearce, 37, told KentOnline: “There are two things on my bucket list - a helicopter ride and seeing lights in the sky like this. "I jumped out my car and screamed to my mum and daughter as soon as I saw them. “It just made me gobsmacked, it brought me tears of joy and has given me hope now for the future.” They were also seen in Thanet, between Westgate and Margate, [earlier in the year which left Ken Blight stunned](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/thanet/news/stunning-rainbow-clouds-caught-on-camera-288903/) as he was strolling along the seafront. A rainbow cloud occurs because of something called cloud iridescence – a phenomenon caused when small water droplets or small ice crystals scatter the sun's light. Although beautiful, this type of formation is said to be one of the most dangerous for our atmosphere as it contributes to the destruction of the ozone layer. According to NASA, the clouds convert benign forms of chlorine into reactive, ozone layer-destroying ones all the while removing the chemicals that moderate its impact. Fogbow You may be forgiven if you missed this rare phenomenon as it is similar in some respects to a traditional rainbow. A [white rainbow, or fogbow](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/medway/news/rare-white-rainbow-spotted-in-kent-281769/) as it is known, was seen back at the start of the year over the River Medway at The Strand, in [Gillingham](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/medway/), by Andy France. It is formed from sunlight interacting with water droplets contained in fog, mist or cloud, rather than interacting with raindrops as it does in a classic rainbow. The droplets cause the light to undergo different physical processes, most notably diffraction, which leads to fogbows appearing to be devoid of colour, hence the nickname of white rainbows. Moon Halo Perhaps not as rare as the other events on this list, it still left residents baffled when they woke up to see a [strange and eerie](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/thanet/news/why-was-the-moon-was-circled-by-a-ring-of-light-283403/) “ring of light" surrounding the moon. Known as a moon halo, it is caused when moonlight passes through thin clouds of ice crystals high up in the Earth's atmosphere. As it does this it is bent, similar to light passing through a lens, and the shape of the crystals causes it to be focused into a ring. They are more common than most people think and can appear during any season and tend to appear several times a year, although they are most frequent in winter due to the colder weather. Water Spout While remaining a rare phenomenon, a number of water spouts have been seen [off the Kent coast this year.](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/dover/news/rare-natural-phenomenon-spotted-as-county-braces-for-storm-c-296091/) The spinning vortexes were seen above the sea off the Herne Bay coast in July and again in St Margaret’s Bay, [Dover](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/dover/), in October. A water spout is similar to a tornado, except touching bodies of water rather than the ground. When they remain airborne without touching land or sea, they are known as funnel clouds, however, as soon as they touch the ground they become tornadoes, or water spouts if they come down over water. Water spouts are very rare off UK coasts, and are more commonly seen in the US and tropical areas. Dust Devil Dramatic photos from July [showed clippings of hay being thrown](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/sandwich/news/walkers-shock-as-devil-levitates-grass-289754/) into the air by a dust devil, also known as a willy will, in Sandwich. The natural event was captured by Andy Vilday, who sent his images to the Met Office which confirmed what it was. According to the government agency, a dust devil is an upward-spiralling vortex of air that can vary in height from a few feet to over 1,000. While they may look similar in appearance to tornadoes, they grow upwards from the ground, rather than down from clouds. They are also not as powerful, and only last a few minutes because cool air is sucked into the base of the rising vortex, cooling the ground and cutting off its heat supply. Bioluminescent algae Finally photographers rushed to Botany Bay, in [Broadstairs](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/thanet/), in the summer as a [rare luminous algae caused the sea to glow](https://www.kentonline.co.uk/thanet/news/beautiful-natural-phenomenon-caught-on-camera-in-kent-288684/) a beautiful neon blue. The phenomenon is difficult to predict and requires “perfect conditions”. Water movement is needed to see the illuminations, as the glow is actually a defence mechanism by the plant when its environment is disturbed. Nature photographer Rebbeca Douglas was one who visited the coast as it was on her bucket list to see the “incredible” sight.

author: Glenn Marshall
title: WKND Warrior awning and rooftop tent combo is out now
text:
WKND Warrior awning and rooftop tent combo is out now Improve your touring set-up with this excellent pairing from WKND Warrior 6 Jan 2024, 09:00 am Share Facebook Twitter Email Copy Link Glenn Marshall Gallery 13 Buy now at WKND Warrior With the WKND Warrior 270 Awning and WKND Odin rooftop tent combo, your outdoor experiences are about to get even better. In a world where exploring the great outdoors has become a way of life, these two products have garnered attention for their exceptional design, functionality and versatility.
What distinguishes this WKND Warrior combo is its seamless compatibility, as the awning and rooftop tent are expertly designed to work together. Using the WKND 316 stainless steel brackets allows the awning to securely attach to the side of the rooftop tent.
Additionally, standard installation options are available for securely mounting the awning to your vehicle's roof rack. There is flexibility when it comes to mounting the rooftop tent, with the choice to mount it directly on to a platform rack, crossbars or canopy.
13 “ The Warrior 270 Awning and Odin rooftop tent are a dynamic duo , a perfect pairing that turns any camping trip into a well-coordinated outdoor masterpiece. Together, they redefine comfort and convenience in the wilderness,” said Kaedon Thiart, owner of WKND Warriors.
The rooftop Tent boasts a sleek and slim design, standing at only 170mm in height (excluding roof racks and solar panels), it is one of the slimmest rooftop tents available. Using robust 280gsm rip-stop polyester-cotton material with double-stitching and waterproofing, you're shielded from the elements, ensuring no seepage or mildew, even on rainy nights.
The tent comes equipped with anti-condensation mats at both the top and bottom, along with three access zippers to perfectly accommodate any touring setup. All of these features are encased in a durable honeycomb aluminium hard shell, providing excellent insulation against varying weather conditions.
Gear Guides Suspension Lights Canopies Bullbars Roof Racks Recovery Gear Storage Tools Camping Tents & Awnings 13 Other features include internal USB/USB-C charging points, six roof storage pockets, a 12V red/white LED strip light, and a 70mm high-density foam mattress. Weighing 65kg, this certainly is a lightweight rooftop tent. The internal sleeping space is 2050mm x 1220mm and the closed dimensions are 2100mm x 1340mm x 170mm, not taking into account the included 125W ultra-thin hard solar panel.
The awning is self-standing, with the externally braced design offering an advantage in maximising your usable shade compared to other 270-degree self-standing awnings. It includes a fold-up pole and features extended final arms and improved rear coverage. Made using the same polycotton as the RTT, the awning is lightweight with functional bracing designed to withstand high winds.
The Warrior 270 awning and WKND Odin rooftop tent combo offers an unbeatable combination of quality, functionality and convenience for only $5500. Buy now at WKND Warrior Glenn Marshall

author: LATTC
title: LATTC Kicks Off 100th Anniversary Celebration  | LATTC
text:
LATTC Kicks Off 100th Anniversary Celebration
On December 5, 2024, LATTC announced the launch of the Foundations' 100th Anniversary celebration campaign: “100 Years of Student Success and Pathways.” To honor LATTC’s founding year, 1925, the LATTC Foundation and the Foundation for the Los Angeles Community Colleges will collaborate to award at least $192,500 in scholarships and other grants to LATTC students in the coming year.
“The LATTC Foundation is thrilled to celebrate the college’s centennial to build unity, inclusiveness and achievement for all students, inspiring a new era of visibility and pride for the next 100 years,” says Bonnie Tseng, LATTC Foundation Board Co-Chair. “We are inspired by the dedication of our students and the 100th anniversary initiatives reflect the Foundation’s ongoing commitment to bringing the community together to support our students’ journey.”
In addition to student scholarships, the college will honor its 100th anniversary with a year-long series of celebrations, including an [alumni mixer and basketball game event](https://www.lattc.edu/campus-life/events/2025/2/5/celebrating-100-years-alumni-mixer-basketball-game-event) on February 5, 2025, which will highlight alumni success stories and strengthen connections with former students. Later in the evening, guests are invited to show their Beaver pride and stay on to support the college’s women’s and men’s basketball teams who will face off in home games against Rio Hondo College. Additional events will be announced soon.
This week, the college also rolled out 100th anniversary commemorative merchandise, which is available both in-store and online via the [College Store website](https://www.lattcbookstore.com/shop_product_list.asp?catalog_group_id=MQ&catalog_group_name=R2VuZXJhbCBNZXJjaGFuZGlzZQ&catalog_id=92&catalog_name=TEFUVEMgMTAwIFllYXJzIEFubml2ZXJzYXJ5).
“Our 100th anniversary is a milestone achievement that serves not only as a reflection of our college history but a renewed promise to empower future generations through innovation, opportunity, and excellence,” says Dr. Alfred McQuarters, President of LATTC. “We’re thrilled to announce new scholarship opportunities and a series of special events that will empower the next generation of leaders, thinkers, and innovators. Together, we will continue to build on a legacy that has shaped countless lives over the past 100 years, ensuring that the next century is one of even greater achievement and impact.”
Those who wish to donate to the 100 Years of Student Success and Pathways campaign may do so via the [LATTC Foundation Centennial website](https://lattcfoundation.nationbuilder.com/lattcfoundation100).
LATTC alumni who wish to reconnect with the college are encouraged to visit the [LATTC alumni webpage](https://www.lattc.edu/about/community/alumni).

author: Fanny Padilla
title: ¿En qué alcaldías de CDMX hay Alerta Amarilla y Naranja por fuertes lluvias este Día de Muertos?
text: Este Día de Muertos se han registrado fuertes lluvias en varias alcaldías de la Ciudad de México, por lo que la Secretaría de Gestión Integral de Riesgos y Protección Civil (SGIRPC) activó la Alerta Amarilla y Naranja. Por medio de sus redes sociales precisó que entre las 6:00 de la tarde a las 10:00 de la noche se prevén fuertes lluvias de entre 15 y 29 mm. La SGIRPC señaló que hay varios peligros asociados con las precipitaciones intensas, tales como caídas de ramas, árboles y lonas, encharcamientos, así como corrientes de agua sobre las avenidas y calles. Posteriormente, unos minutos antes de las 7:00 de la noche, la SGIRPC precisó que hay lluvias puntuales fuertes en las alcaldías Cuajimalpa, Miguel Hidalgo, Benito Juárez, en Coyoacán, Magdalena Contreras, Tlalpan, Álvaro Obregón, [Cuauhtémoc](https://www.razon.com.mx/ciudad/2024/11/01/alessandra-rojo-de-la-vega-encabeza-primer-comite-de-seguridad-en-la-cuauhtemoc/), Iztapalapa y Tláhuac. Marcha en CDMX Jufed convoca a realizar una concentración este 5 de noviembre en la SCJN ¿En qué alcaldías hay Alerta Amarilla por lluvias? - En la alcaldía Miguel Hidalgo - Alcaldía Azcapotzalco En caso de — Secretaría de Gestión Integral de Riesgos y PC (@SGIRPC_CDMX)[#lluvias], toma en cuenta las recomendaciones que Ollin, el chapulín de la prevención, tiene para ti.[#PronósticoDelTiempo][#LaPrevenciónEsNuestraFuerza][#OperativoLluvias2024][#JefeTláloc][pic.twitter.com/21JLc3Hnnh][November 2, 2024] Alcaldías con Alerta Naranja Las demarcaciones donde hay Alerta Naranja esta noche tendrán lluvias entre los 30 y 39 mm, además de posible caída de granizo. - Alcaldía Álvaro Obregón - Alcaldía Cuajimalpa - Alcaldía Magdalenas Contreras Cuídate con estas recomendaciones para la temporada de lluvias - En medida de lo posible, intenta impermeabilizar el techo de tu casa - Barre el techo para evitas que se acumule el agua - Si hay alguna inundación, desconecta tu energía eléctrica - Mantén sin basura la calle y barre la coladera más cercana a tu casa - En caso de inundación, quédate en sitios elevados como los segundos pisos y azoteas - No pises cables de electricidad caídos - Evita las zonas con escurrimiento y con lodo - Usa cloro para desinfectar tu casa y así evitar infecciones - No tires desperdicios en ríos y barrancas - Si utilizas bicicleta, porta un impermeable antirreflejante - Cierra bien tus puertas y ventanas - En caso de tener alguna emergencia puedes comunicarte al número 911, para reportar caída de árboles es en el número del Locatel 56 58 11 11 o marcando *0311 [Únete a nuestro canal de WhatsApp](https://www.whatsapp.com/channel/0029Va4honc30LKY9Z0wAT1u). En La Razón enviamos a tu celular lo más importante México y el Mundo, recuerda que una persona informada siempre tiene La Razón. FBPT
